entry.title: newsletter #72
entry.content:
Hello Folks!

Here we go with the first #TechThursday for 2015.

Every now and then it happens that people in our team wear the same geeky T-shirt… T-shirt clash:

{% img center /images/t-shirt.jpg %}

  • Crapify, a proxy for simulating slow, spotty, HTTP connections

  • Why you should not use Angular

  • Blameless PostMortems and a Just Culture

  • The indtroduction to Reactive Programming

  • The DevOps Wonder

  • React js Vs Angular js

  • Scrawl – web capture crawler

  • Docker – Beginner’s tutorial

  • Dockerized Symfony Project

  • Novm – legacy-free, type 2 hypervisor written in Go

  • Why you should pay developers to learn

  • How can React and Flux help us create better Angular applications?

  • How Much Testing is Too Much?

  • Agile Won’t Fix Your Organization

  • Cross-Account Access in the AWS Management Console

  • EC2 Spot Instance Termination Notices

  • Docker – Demo on PHP Application deployment

  • Symfony2 Over Yii

  • JavaScript source code visualization, static analysis, and complexity tool

  • Chrome Canary improvements to the Network panel

  • A coding tool on mobile devices targeting GitHub/Codeship/Heroku

  • What the Heck is Shadow DOM?

  • Working Effectively With iTerm2

entry.title: Newsletter #64
entry.content:
Hello friends from the software engineering community!

News from the tech team:

Cirpo, Alex, Oba and Manuel went to the first Rocket Internet Global Tech Summit in Berlin last week. Oba and Alex gave two talks about our internal technology and stack. It was a great opportunity to meet and discuss with other tech leads from all the Rocket Internet ventures from all around the world.

{% img team right /images/berlin.png %}

It’s #TechThursday at #namshi!

Here is the list with awesome links to keep you busy during the weekend:

  • Taco App – a unified task list, getting tasks from 40+ sources

  • Become a Better Programmer: 5 Essential Methods at a Glance

  • FrontEnd Vs Backend Developer Infographic

  • StackShare.io – Discover & discuss software stacks

  • Technical Debt Takes Many Forms

  • Master Developers: Addy Osmani

  • Windows port of Docker Client by ahmetalpbalkan..things start moving!

  • A Quick Introduction to CoreOS

  • Front-end Tooling Workflows // this is a GREAT presentation

  • Symfony 3.0: The roadmap

  • Amazon Deploys to Production Every 11.6 Seconds // I think now its around every 6s…

  • Reactâ€™s diff algorithm

  • VisualOps: no more heavy lifting in the cloud

  • SaltStack Delivers More Advanced Cloud Orchestration for Amazon Web Services and Pagerduty

  • AWS CodeDeploy

  • Amazon RDS for Aurora

  • The DevOps Scorecard

  • Realtime Search: Solr vs Elasticsearch

  • How to avoid the split-brain problem in elasticsearch

  • Scaling Massive Elastic-Search Clusters

  • HHVM packages support

  • HackSummit, a virtual conference for developers

  • A 3D environment with lighting, shadows built with CSS transforms

  • Reactive mvc and the virtual dom

  • Async PHP with React

  • A presentation about PHP 7

  • Information Security in PHP: the CIA Triad Approach
